newsitem.title: USA: GM CEO hopes there'll be no local US strikes.
newsitem.headline: GM CEO hopes there'll be no local US strikes.

text.p: General Motors Corp chief executive John Smith told reporters he hoped there would be no local strikes by the United Auto Workers in the United States.
Questioned at a news conference called to discuss GM's participation in development of alternate fueled vehicles, Smith declined to comment on the status of talks with the union.
The existing contract expired at midnight Sunday, but workers have stayed on the job.
Asked about the effects of the recent 20-day strike in Canada, Smith declined to give specific figures on the dollar cost to GM or the effect on October sales.
"We lost quite a few cars," he commented.
